intro: Gonostemon vetulus, commonly known as the Mexican flame tree, is a flowering plant native to Central America and northern South America. It is a member of the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bright yellow to orange-red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has opposite, simple, and often hairy leaves that are elliptical in shape. It produces long, slender pods that contain seeds covered in a silky, fibrous coating. Gonostemon vetulus is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display and adaptability to various soil conditions.
